question: Hi!  I've been Hep C+ since 1988 and I am want to get more info/support.  Under the care of an internist and heptalogist, but not as fully informed as I should be.My story:  blood transfusions in 1988 while receiving cancer treatment.  Acute hepatitis in 8/88 - jaundice, fatigue, vomitting.  Took about 2 years to get my stamina back, but never returned to pre-cancer and pre-HepC+ state.  Cancer is cured - in remission now for 15 years.Since '88, I have had problems with depression (2 episodes and medications didn't seem to help), diagnosed with fibromyalgia (which resolved itself in 6 months), feel tired a lot and need to sleep 9 to 10 hours a night.  Along the way, I have gained weight and am having a hell of a time trying to lose weight.  In 1997 I had Bell's Palsy and in 1999 I was diagnosed with Type II diabetes.  I recently (in 2002) began reading about a link between Hep C and Type II diabetes: people with Hep C are 4 times more likely to develop Type II diabetes.  My endocrinologist says that have a liver disease increases insulin resistance, a precursor of Type II (and gaining weight).My doctor's aren't recommending treatment right now.  My liver enzymes are only slightly elevated.  I'd like to have a child as well.  I am holding out for the antiviral medications that are in the pipeline.Emotionally, I am having a real hard time with all these medical problems.  I don't see myself as a "patient", but I also don't feel well a lot of the time.  I am angry that I have Hep C and afraid.I know you all can relate.  Any one else having so many problems?
title: Do you share my experiences with Hep C?
